post_text: MVSD’s PE teachers are keeping students moving, even at a distance, by providing exercise videos that students of all grade levels, as well as their families can access remotely while safe at home. The teacher created videos include yoga, cross fit, stretching, HIIT (High Intensity Interval Training), motor skills, sports, Zumba, cardio, and more. They have also shared fun in-home and backyard games utilizing items students have at home to promote being active such as a balloon race and family football follies. Exercise can have a huge impact on mental health by easing stress, anxiety and depression that many may be feeling due to the uncertain times of the pandemic.

MVSD will be offering support to District families who need assistance completing the census.

The District received the California School Boards Association’s esteemed Golden Bell Award this year for this outstanding Parent Leadership Academy.

post_text: Baker School hosted a Family Math Festival last night, welcoming students in grades TK through 5th and their families for a night of fun, hands-on educational math activities provided by California Math Festivals. Working side-by-side, students and family members tackled challenging math problems at 12 different activity stations. post_text: MVSD celebrated the families that participated in the District’s fall session of the Family Biliteracy Program. The special celebration, hosted by the Family Engagement Department, honored families from all 10 of the District’s elementary schools including Baker, Cogswell, La Primaria, Maxson, Miramonte, Monte Vista, Parkview, Payne, Twin Lakes and Voorhis. The goal of the Family Biliteracy Program is to strengthen family connections through literature and language. Throughout the program participants were involved in hands-on projects, engaging discussions and high levels of critical literacy. Utilizing bilingual books, they learned strategies for engaging students in their primary language using dialogic reading. The celebration included a stunning display of the many amazing projects completed by the families during the program. Thank you to the Family Biliteracy Program teachers, Community Liaisons and Administrators from each site as well as our Board of Education for their vision and commitment to building family connections through literacy and primary language.
